body.name: Evenflo Feeding Balance Plus Stage 1 Cylindrical Baby, Newborn and Infant Pacifier - Developed with Pediatric Feeding Specialists - 0 to 6 Months (Pack of 6)

Or fastest delivery Monday, February 19. Order within 8 hrs 2 mins
features: STAGE 1 - Designed to help promote a natural tongue position, the Balance Plus Cylinder Pacifier helps infants 0-6 months self-soothe while supporting healthy sucking skills

SUPPORTS BREASTFEEDING - The shape of your nipple and areola changes when your baby latches on to your breast Your baby's tongue cups around the nipple For the 0-6 month baby, the cylindrical shape pacifier allows for the baby to mimic the tongue shape they make while breastfeeding
REDUCES FATIGUE - The soft materials and designed flexibility are important to discourage mouth fatigue in growing infants
EASY-GRIP DESIGN – This flexible, 1-piece silicone pacifier has an easy-grip handle that makes it easy for both mom and baby to hold

EASY TO CLEAN - The cylindrical pacifiers come in a re-sealable steam sanitization bag that can be used up to 5 times for easy cleaning Just add 2 ounces of water and place in the microwave (see instructions for heating times)
BPA FREE - You’re committed to your child’s safety and so is Evenflo Feeding Their pacifiers are 100% free of BPA, polycarbonates, PVC, and phthalates, and are constructed of food grade materials
body.description: The Evenflo Balance + Stage 1 Pacifier was expertly designed for infants 0-6 months to self-soothe while supporting healthy sucking skills.

manufacturerProductDescription.media_text: The Shape Cylindrical shape helps promote a natural tongue position and allows baby to mimic the tongue shape they make while breastfeeding. Promotes Tongue Cupping The Balance + Pacifier is designed to help safeguard your breastfeeding journey. When breastfeeding, the shape of your nipple and areola changes when your baby latches on to your breast. Your baby's tongue cups around the nipple. For the 0-6 month baby, the cylindrical shape pacifier allows for the baby to mimic the tongue shape they make while breastfeeding. Comfortable Integrated vent holes helps keep skin dry and the easy-grip handles makes it convenient for baby and parent to hold. The Texture 1-piece soft silicone design is flexible and lightweight and features a curved faceplate, making it easier for baby to suck on for longer periods of time.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on July 14, 2022
reviews.reviewText: My little spent 100+ days in the NICU where she became quite attached to her green/teal soothie. However, she was never able to fully keep it in her mouth unassisted which would make for a middle of the night fussy babe, a dirty soothie from its roll on the floor, and a tired/frustrated momma. After months of trying different options because I really wanted to be able to attach it to a clip of sorts (soothies have a solid handle making this impossible without poking a hole through it), I just wasn’t having any luck. All other silicone options we tried were too bulky, heavy, or wasn’t just one piece which trapped water/germs. But, I came across this one and gave it a shot. Needless to say, I have been pleased so far! It’s about the same weight as her NICU soothie, but with a curve that helps it to sit more snug on the contour of her face which makes for less falling out. It’s all one piece, so no germs or trapped water, but it has a handle which allows for attaching a clip without issue. And, the color is a frosted clear so it goes with anything - looks super cute with her boho wooden clip! I haven’t had it long, so I haven’t noticed any color change from use, but will update.**UPDATE: This one is still going strong a year later! No rips or tears, and no yellowing (which is a HUGE plus)!! The only gripe I have is that it's friggen clear... so, I definitely have a love-hate relationship with this pacifier. I LOVE that it's clear because it goes with everything (Yeah, I match outfits to paci's *shrug*), but oh boy, don't let your little walk away with it or drop it in the bed somewhere without a clip or other attachment because it'll be an eternity before you find it again!Now... I just have to find a way to wean my little one off of this thing...

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on March 20, 2022
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Best Features: Clear, Loop, Small, Price
reviews.reviewText: 1. These are clear, which is so cool because you can see your baby sucking on them. They can sometimes be a little hard to see/find if you don’t have a pacifier clip on them.2. The loop is perfect for attaching pacifier clips, which we LOVE. This has saved so many pacifiers from being thrown out of the stroller, car seat, you name it. They stay cleaner for longer. The loop is a great feature, and I prefer Evenflo over Phillips Avent because of it.3. They’re small and soft, which my baby prefers. These were one of the first pacifiers she would take without gagging or spitting it out right away. When she was a newborn the only ones we found that seemed small enough for her to tolerate were Nanobebe.4. These pacifiers are such a great price! So you can buy more of them, haha! We bought a bunch of them to scatter around the crib, stock the diaper bag, and clip onto everything. We don’t go anywhere without an Evenflo pacifier on standby.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on July 20, 2023
reviews.reviewText: We have tried lots of different pacifiers (I.e., MAM, Nanobebe, Phillips Avent, Tommee Tippee, Itzy Ritzy, etc.) and these are the ones our girl liked best! They are so soft and flexible! We ordered the clear and they are difficult to find when dropped and at night, so I recommend getting a different color.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 25, 2023
reviews.reviewText: I loved these clear pacis so did my baby. These compare to the green ones from hospitals But cuter. I loved that they're clear and was able to attach a paci clip to them too.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on July 14, 2023
reviews.reviewText: Good for babies with smaller mouths

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on September 24, 2023
reviews.reviewText: My 1month old loves this paci. Perfect size for his mouth, easy to clean & light weight. Highly suggest getting a paci holder to place on it when it’s not in child’s mouth. It can disappear on you due to the clear color, we have over looked it multiple times when not in use.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 31, 2023
reviews.reviewText: I love this Evenflo pacifiers!! They are amazing, my baby is exclusively breastfed and he loves it ! In the beginning when he was a newborn he didn’t really like it I’m guessing because the size itself was too big for his little mouth. But that depends baby to baby every baby is different. Once my little one turned 5 weeks this is the only pacifier he takes up to this date, his now 4 months and still loves it !! I’m definitely going to purchase stage 2 of this even Flo pacifier

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 9, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Stage one? Stage none.
reviews.reviewText: Still my toddlers favorite paci. Not recommended for children with a mouth full of teeth, but my almost 3 year old still loves them. Good thing it came with multiples as we are down to the last one that hasn’t been chewed. Also served us well when she was a baby, but she’s not quite ready to say good bye yet.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on May 4, 2023
reviews.reviewText: The material is sticky and this collects bits really easily. Makes it very hard to clean quickly and unhygienic. Will not be giving to my baby.

reviews.reviewTitle: La forma más adecuada para bebé amamantado
reviews.reviewText: Finalmente aceptó el chupón mi bebé después de un mes, sin embargo pongo 4 estrellas porque difícilmente se queda puesto. Mi bebé se duerme con él y debo de dejarlo contra mi pecho posteriormente se le cae
Llegaron en buen tiempo y en excelente estado, lástima que están muy grandes
Le encantaron a mis dos nietecitos recién nacidos, aunque son un poco grandes
